questions.question: In March 2020, the Fed decreased interest rates to 0% in response to covid 19. Why was this done?

choices.answer: To erase all debt owed by the U.S.
To make it harder for people/businesses to borrow money
To make it easier for people/businesses to borrow money
To stop all importing and exporting of goods

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describes the Federal Reserve?

choices.answer: The agency that manages public debt
A branch of government that issues loans
One of 12 major American banks
The official bank of the U.S. government

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of the Federal Reserve?

choices.answer: Maintaining stable financial markets
Issuing stimulus packages to boost the economy
Regulating/supervising financial institutions﻿
Conducting the nation’s monetary policy

questions.question: How are the Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Federal Reserve hired?

choices.answer: Appointed by Senate; approved by President
Appointed by Senate; approved by VP
Appointed by President; approved by Senate
Appointed by VP; approved by Senate

questions.question: On 11/5/20, after two days of meetings, the Fed announced their decision to:

choices.answer: Delay a decision until 2021
Increase interest rates
Decrease interest rates
Make no change to interest rates
